B1_Title: Prof. Dr. Khaled Gad's Speech , Deputy Director for Extension at the Institute
B1: The primary role of the Agricultural Research Center
First: Development of new crop varieties.
Second: Production of breeder and foundation seeds.
Third: Issuing technical recommendations for various crops.

Fourth: Technology transfer, extension, and training. I believe this role is the most important, because without it, the other roles cannot succeed in fulfilling their mission. One of the institute’s key messages is introducing farmers to the latest high-quality, high-yielding, and climate-resilient varieties, as well as the latest technical recommendations to achieve maximum productivity, especially under changing climate conditions. This is achieved through various activities, including training extension staff in different governorates to convey information to farmers, and training young researchers at the institute on the latest scientific techniques, as well as languages, computer skills, and more.
